title: Checking Facts in a President's Speech
summary: President Trump gave a speech on TV to talk about the economy. He said he has done a great job and blamed others for problems like high prices. A reporter named Liz Landers checked if what he said was true. She looked at a poll that asked people what they think about the economy. The poll showed that many people do not like how President Trump is handling the economy. This article helps us understand how to check facts in speeches to know what is real.

background_read: This article is about a speech by President Trump where he discussed the economy and blamed others for issues like high prices. A reporter fact-checked his claims using a poll that showed many Americans disapprove of his handling of the economy. It teaches us how to verify information in public speeches to understand the truth.
Article_Structure: WHO: President Trump and reporter Liz Landers
WHAT: A fact-check of a speech about the economy
WHY: To check if the claims in the speech are true and inform people

perspectives.description: Some might think President Trump is right about his achievements and that the poll is not accurate.
Others might believe the fact-check shows his claims are not fully true and that the poll reflects real concerns.
